programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The NCIS team races against time to find a missing officer who disappears during his wedding proposal.

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: NCIS investigates the death of a college student who was killed while running across the street and had connections to McGee's wife.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: NCIS agents from Washington, D.C., Los Angeles and Hawaii, in D.C. to attend the retirement party of a beloved Federal Law Enforcement Training Center professor, find themselves investigating his shocking suicide.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Parker discovers he's a victim of identity theft while investigating the unusual murder of a Navy ensign; Knight and Jimmy face hurdles in their relationship as their connection heightens.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue is shocked to discover her friend Troy (Deaf actor - and Deanne Bray's real-life husband - Troy Kotsur) has been arrested for armed robbery - a crime he swears he didn't commit.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and the team are approached by a woman who claims she's witnessed a murder - but the case is turned on its head when they discover the eyewitness has a disturbing secret of her own.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: While investigating a bank robbery, Sue and the team discover it was robbed five years ago - has the robber returned to the scene of the crime? The clue trail leads them to a surprising twist.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue is offered an exciting new high-profile job at the FBI - but is torn when she realizes it means leaving her FBI teammates and friends, including twelve-year-old Amanda, behind.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull breaks from the stress he's been under for months when a mysterious delivery causes him to black out for hours, leaving him with no memory of his movements.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: When Bull handles the defense of a building owner accused of killing tenants by carbon monoxide poisoning, the case rocks Bull and the team to their core.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull and the team head to court one last time to finalize a negligent homicide defense that will change the nature of their company and their lives forever.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Dr. Jason Bull uses psychology, intuition and data to create strategies to help clients of his trial consulting firm win cases.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Dr. Bull and his team must come up with a new defense for a female pilot accused of negligence when they discover the jury has a gender bias.

programme.title: Criminal Minds

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When a young boy disappears from his home in St. Louis, the team examines a similar cold case for clues.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Blake must work with her retired police captain father and her detective brother to solve a series of murders in Kansas City.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A murder investigation results in Garcia delving into her hacker past -- and reconnecting with a former flame.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: As the team searches for a vigilante killer in Cleveland, Rossi's former Marine sergeant goes missing in Los Angeles; J.J.'s secret catches up with her.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When J.J. is abducted, the team looks into her time at the State Department in hope of finding clues regarding her disappearance.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team searches for a pair of suspects responsible for several murders near Pittsburgh; Morgan and Garcia make Valentine's Day plans with their significant others.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU makes startling discoveries as they search for a 4-year-old girl who went missing while staying with a relative.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Maggie and OA must find a couple that is responsible for a spree of violent armed robberies that led to the death of an off-duty police officer.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a bombing at a local restaurant leaves several injured or dead, including a congresswoman and someone close to Isobel, the team races to apprehend the suspect before another explosive goes off.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After an employee of the U.S. Army is shot in an industrial park, the team works to track down the killer who reveals a larger plot at play; Tiffany continues to struggle with the guilt surrounding Hobbs' death.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a retired FBI agent is tortured and killed while working a security job, Scola and Nina go under cover as a married couple deep in the diamond game as the team tries to find out who is responsible.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a federal judge is gunned down in broad daylight, the team is sent looking for a suspect with ties to a local Islamic center; Maggie reunites with a former colleague.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When the director of a Brooklyn migrant center is abducted and held hostage along with his wife, the team must work quickly to meet the demands of their kidnapper; Maggie picks Jessica's brain about motherhood.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After multiple people are targeted and killed with a poisonous gas in broad daylight, the team races to find the killer; Maggie continues to explore motherhood.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: The virtual world has real consequences in Mike Hammer's latest case. Mike Hammer is offered a case by the worried grandmother of a missing young woman. Tamara had been working as a model for a racy website before her disappearance, and when Hammer's team discovers a snuff film posted online, he worries that she may have been victimized by something much more serious. Mike Hammer is on the case to either find Tamara, or bring her murderers to justice.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mayron Hughes may be one of the most sought after basketball players in the country, but the mysterious death of his former agents could threaten everything. The star athlete hires New York's most valuable private eye in order to prove his own innocence. The case becomes increasingly complicated, and the Hammer must look at an entire roster of suspects in order to find the real killer. From Mayron father to his new agent to Mayron himself, anyone could be the culprit.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: A Hollywood actress with hometown ties to Hammer becomes the primary suspect in the gruesome murder of her own producer and boyfriend. In order to clear her name, she asks Mike to finds the real killer. The East Coast's best private eye must head West to get to the truth behind the lies. But as Hammer conducts his investigation, the situation in Malibu turns sticky, and he discovers that nothing is as it seems.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: It's Devil's Night in New York, and this year's Halloween festivities prove especially deadly. Before their date, Mike Hammer's love interest is murdered in her own apartment. With his heart broken and his own life on the line, Hammer must track down the heinous murderer. With Hammer's friends being targeted, he discovers a pattern that points to a cultist killer that he had locked up before. Mike must solve the case quickly, or he could be next.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team hunts for a person who jeopardized a classified vaccine project; Deeks must deal with his emotions as he returns to the field.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team winds up in danger as they investigate the kidnapping of a man claiming to be Callen's father.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A former Navy officer's girlfriend is kidnapped, and demands are made for classified intelligence; Deeks accidentally breaks one of Hetty's rules.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team must alert Homeland Security when they uncover a threat to a Los Angeles-based train during a murder investigation.

programme.desc: Severide comes back to work, but isn't his usual self; Mills discovers more information about his father's family; Herrmann asks Molly investors to share ideas that could help turn the business around.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Dawson tries to find balance with Lt. Casey; Mills deals with a future without the squad; Severide faces his demons; the Molly's crew meets with a city inspector.

programme.desc: Severide wants further investigation when a homeowner saved from a fire is found clutching a suspicious box; Molly's II needs a chef.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: The members of the firehouse spring into action when a helicopter explodes over a densely populated area, scattering debris; a dangerous man corners Brett.

programme.title: My Uncle Is the Green River Killer
programme.desc: After living with the stigma of being related to a serial killer, family members confront Gary Ridgeway in an effort to heal their emotional wounds and bring closure to the families of his victims.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: Investigators gain unprecedented access to files, unearthing a complicated cypher that may contain the killer's name as well as links between the Zodiac Killer and an unsolved case; a prime suspect with code training emerges.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: The team uncovers clues that the killer may have served in the U.S. Armed Forces, as the supercomputer identifies symbols in the code that would have been known to only a few when it was written; Sal and Ken find new evidence.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: The team uncovers a mysterious new cipher related to the Zodiac Killer, while the supercomputer uncovers a strange lunar pattern linking the killings; a taunting riddle by the killer may lead to a body; a second prime suspect emerges.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: The hunt goes into high gear as the FBI releases secret files on the killer; a handwriting analyst connects the Zodiac's letters to a taunting letter mailed 3,000 miles away in Albany, N.Y.; the code team has a massive breakthrough on the Z-340.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Zodiac Killer
programme.desc: Sal and Ken investigate San Francisco, the epicenter of the Zodiac Killer murders; the Code Team announces a team member has solved the Zodiac's infamous Z340 code, which has eluded codebreakers for 50 years.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Examining if modern technology and scientific knowledge can help protect people from almost anything, including natural disasters, or if vulnerability remains a factor.

programme.title: The UnXplained

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether the ancients had scientific knowledge lost to time; how and why they fashioned remarkable feats of engineering.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: UFOs sightings are more common among police offices than you might believe and many have witnessed things they can't explain.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Six "doughnut-shaped aircraft" were spotted off the coast of Maury Island, WA one week before the reported UFO crash in Roswell, NM. Harold Dahl and his son witnessed the aircraft dancing in unknown form and one spewing white-hot fragments over the water.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: In 1956, an object was detected over the North Sea heading toward Bentwaters RAF base--a base with nuclear weapons. Two Venom fighters made contact with the object, but their weapons and electrical systems were rendered useless.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Reverse engineering is a common practice used by private industry and the government as a means to keep up with or surpass the competition. Has the US military derived various forms of technology, including stealth technology, from downed UFO's?

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: For years, people have claimed to have had direct, personal contact with an alien. In this episode of our series, the team tracks down several people who claim to have had such contact.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: On January 28, 1994, an Air France pilot, his crew and passengers witnessed a brightly-glowing red and brown disc-shaped object while flying to London.

programme.title: UFO Hunters

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: In a city of eight million, landlord Bruce Blackwood disappears without a trace in March 2006. Though there is no body, the NYPD is sure this is a homicide.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: 13 days after Pam Pitts disappears in 1988 her body is found at a hangout spot in the Arizona desert. Then a second victim is discovered.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: When a woman is brutally murdered on New Years Day 1985, a little boy is left motherless. A family must wait 35 years for advancements in forensic science to catch a killer.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, the brutal murder of 19-year-old Tiffany Johnston rocks the small town of Bethany, Oklahoma. DNA points to her killer over a decade later.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: Weaving together the stories of five of America's most notorious serial killers - Ted Bundy, John Wayne Gacy, Jeffrey Dahmer, the Green River Killer and BTK.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: In the mid-to-late 1970s, Bundy, Gacy and BTK begin claiming victims, while Dahmer and the Green River Killer inch ever closer to realizing their grim fantasies.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: With their confidence growing in 1978, Bundy, Gacy, Dahmer, the Green River Killer, and BTK continue their game of cat and mouse with law enforcement; Gacy and Bundy are finally brought to justice; Dahmer struggles to resist his murderous urges.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: After years of evading capture, Gacy and Bundy are finally brought to justice as they both face punishment for their heinous crimes.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: Two of The Five, Gacy and Bundy, sit on death row in the mid-1980s as their murderous rampages are curtailed.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: After years of public fear at the hands of "The Five," the remaining three killers are captured between 1991-2005.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Sixteen-year-old Aaron Campbell didn't admit his horrific crimes until after his conviction; in the dead of night, he abducted six-year-old neighbor Alesha MacPhail and carried her to a nearby wood, where he raped and murdered her.

programme.desc: Beloved 60-year-old chiropractor Mary Yoder falls violently ill and is rushed to the hospital; two days later, she dies, leaving her family and friends in a state of stunned disbelief; Mary's autopsy report reveals she didn't die of natural causes.

Smith, Harry Reasoner, Barbara Walters, Peter Jennings, Charles Gibson, Bob Woodruff, Elizabeth Vargas and -- most recently -- Diane Sawyer.

programme.desc: David Muir, former anchor of "ABC World News" weekend edition, tackles the responsibility of helming the weekday report of breaking news, taking the chair previously held by other well-known journalists: John Daly, Frank Reynolds, Howard K. Smith, Harry Reasoner, Barbara Walters, Peter Jennings, Charles Gibson, Bob Woodruff, Elizabeth Vargas and -- most recently -- Diane Sawyer.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team revamps an old school '34 Buick into a modern day lowrider; after months of rebuilding the body and making a custom frame for Earl Campbell's '49 Cadillac, the Hall of Famer challenges the shop with a last-minute wrinkle.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A long-time client wants to improve upon a near-perfect '68 Ford Ranger; the team is up to the task with an all-new custom chassis, handmade interior, rebuilt bed and Coyote 5.0 engine swap; the guys check off new custom upgrades on a '75 Bronco.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 Impala throws the guys for a loop when they discover it's an imposter; the team makes it better than ever, with custom body fabrications, rear subframe and handmade interior.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Truck builds tend to get bigger than originally planned, so it's no surprise when a 1971 Suburban goes even bigger with a custom lifted air suspension and interior; a nearly finished 2006 Kodiak needs just one more custom upgrade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and his team make one of their longest custom chassis ever for a new 2020 Denali, and Ekstensive gets a diesel pro-mod drag car back on the track.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive turns a stock 2020 Denali dually into a frame-dropping, show-stopping work truck; as a final touch, Bill handmakes articulating speakers for the bed; Bill takes a family's minds off their brush with a custom 2019 Polaris Ranger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets déjà vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A local client wants the teams help to surprise his dad with a custom 1946 Ford Coupe; Bill goes for a mix of both classy and supercharged when working on his wife's 2021 Escalade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys hit the home stretch on the '46 Ford Blue Thunder, its once-rusted shell now rebuilt into a one-of-one showstopper; Bill is surprised when John Cena drops off a '69 MGC.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Builds include a 1979 Little Red Express and a Suzuki Samurai lake crosser.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Builds include a Samurai rock crawler and a Gladiator with a Hellcat.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Mod Mafia transforms a fire-damaged M1038 Humvee ambulance into an extreme camping overlander; the Wide Open Garage team builds a bulletproof race car for the appropriately billed Death Car Race, in which drivers are blindfolded.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A request about a 1947 Ford truck becomes 1 Way Diesel Performance's next ground-up build; Mod Mafia jumps into uncharted territory with a Viper ACRX race car.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Looking into what happens if a Cummins diesel engine is put into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo; a customer wants Wide Open Garage to turn an old, rusted Chevy truck into a lifted, all-terrain truck on huge 74-inch tires.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Putting a twin-turbo Cummins into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo is a monster build unlike any other for 1 Way Diesel Performance. YouTube's "Unspeakable" star Nathan Graham asks Mod Mafia to help him out of a jam with his all-terrain, amphibious SHERP.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The 1991 Land Rover Defender is known for ruggedness and simplicity; Mod Mafia does a reboot of a tired, old Defender with modern performance, power and custom luxury; Wide Open Garage takes an old-school Bronco monster truck into overdrive.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Social media star Liver King not only wants Mod Mafia to beef up his prized 2001 H1 Hummer's performance, he wants to customize it for his primal lifestyle; the team at Wide Open Garage must build a custom off-road truck completely from scratch.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Wide Open Garage's mega-truck build gets even bigger as they take an old-school '82 C10 square body and create a one-of-one show truck, monster truck; one Way Diesel Performance lives up to their name by giving an '88 Silverado more than 1,200 horsepower.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: 1 Way Diesel Performance is thrown a mega-curveball with a classic '48 Dodge Power Wagon. In a race pitting garage vs. garage, a 2,700hp diesel truck hits the line against a turbocharged first-generation Camaro.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Erik Estrada wants to transform his wood-paneled ’83 Rolls-Royce limo.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Team Unique takes on a major project for Nick Cannon's 1967 Chevelle.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Geraldo Rivera brings his 2004 Tacoma to Team Unique.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: The team flips a Range Rover makeover for rapper Fat Joe.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Team Unique transforms Mike Epps' Camaro into a custom dream ride.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: In the snowy landscape of Michigan's Northern Peninsula, Derek finds a 1964 Ford Galaxie that's sat abandoned for 32 years; he plans to not only get this Ford running, but also to turn it into a rally-tribute car.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek teams up with Dave Chappelle to revitalize a 1972 Jeep J2000 that's sat among a field of neglected Jeeps; together, they cobble together parts from various Jeeps to get theirs running and attempt to make the 100-mile journey to Derek's shop.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek teams up with his brother Sean to convert a 1966 Oldsmobile F-85 from a wannabe drag racer into a timeless cruiser; it'll take more than a paint job to make this car street-able, as the guys discover the engine is keeping a horrible secret.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek Bieri and Dave Chappelle find an old dually among a flock of chickens; with the goal of building this rig into a car-hauling shop truck, Derek sets his sights on major performance upgrades, while Dave gets to work on a custom suspension setup.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek enlists Steve Dulcich to help put the muscle back into a derelict Dodge Coronet. But with a completely seized drivetrain, the guys will have to replace everything on this car if they hope to make the 500-mile road trip back to Nashville.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: Two brothers set out to build matching Track Rat Porsches; one lost interest due to lack of funds and time; with a Porsche racing pedigree and a not-so-stock surprise under the hood, Shea thinks this 944 is the perfect project to rescue.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: Dan and Shea drive out to Clovis, New Mexico, to buy the holy grail of JDM imports, a Toyota AE86; nostalgia aside, Aaron is skeptical whether it was a good buy, or even roadworthy.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: What was supposed to be an unfinished project feels more like a mechanic special; with problem after problem, it looks like this car was closer to ending up in a landfill than laying down 11s leaving the car meet.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: A shop owner's crew builds a SR20-powered Ford Ranger Urban Assault Vehicle, but when the turbo gives out, he knows it needed to go before it become more of a distraction; Aaron fixes the reliability issues; Dan and Shea go in on suspension.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: Shea, Dan and guest Wiley Stevens get less than they bargained for when a mess of a project car turns up and doesn't look anything like its photos.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: Aaron and Dan rescue a rust-riddled 1989 Honda CRX.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: Shea and Aaron give Dan a push to finish his C5 Corvette project.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: A stalled RX-7 project has the makings to be a powerhouse drift car.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: A Miata with shoddy welds will be ripping rooster tails in the dunes soon.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: A Miata with shoddy welds will be ripping rooster tails in the dunes soon.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: A V-8-powered Subaru STI needs a complete mechanical overhaul.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: A 1966 Chevy Impala convertible gets a full makeover, with new paint, motor, interior and top, plus a ton of rust repair; the previous owner was forced to sell it to cover health bills, but now his wife and son want him to have his prized car back.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Shorty takes on the huge challenge of making a Vietnam veteran's long-bed '69 C10 cool; he hopes to achieve that by taking the truck back to stock, with original two-tone paint and moldings, a new stance, updated interior and new wheels.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Shorty and the team beef up a 1971 Cutlass with muscle and updated style.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: NFL linebacker, Matt Judon, wants to transform his father's 1977 Eldorado and bring it back to its original glory; the guys get the body straight and rust free with a new pearl white paint job; upgrades to the motor, AC, interior and more.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Shorty and crew turn the shell of a '67 Nova into a mean street machine.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Shorty and Terry unearth a rare 1969 Impala with 14,000 original miles on it; the guys go to work on getting it running and putting it on bags with new wheels and tires; Pete is looking to upgrade his 1958 Impala.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Shorty and Pete need to find a Volkswagen delivery bus to round out a collector's dream of creating a VW museum; they track down an extremely rare panel van that's been out to pasture under a pecan tree, but Shorty and Pete think it will be perfect.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Work continues on the Volkswagen delivery bus, as Shorty gets down in the paint booth on this giant beast; it's time to get this bus across the finish line with a new motor, new suspension, new stance and brand new wheels and tires.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: The owner, Sanders, has had some bad luck with this '56 Belair going from shop to shop, and he still doesn't have his family dream car ready. Shorty's shop is the last stop. Joel and Shorty make sure this car is ready for the road.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Paul decides to take one of his prized 1959s and go full lowrider with hydraulics and a full custom lowrider paint job; Shorty's wife Lupe has a 1992 Mustang GT 5.0, and Shorty has a honey do list to get this car back to its original glory.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: A good customer brings a troubled 1965 Ford Mustang into the shop; Noah and the crew attempt to restore life to a 1965 Cobra that is not running.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: Noah challenges his crew to improve on two amazing cars.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: Noah has his hands full with a couple carrying two separate visions.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: Noah and his team work on a 1962 Corvette.

programme.title: Episode 7
programme.desc: Who is the real ‘Loose Cannon’? Lily Newhouse is the amateur who qualified to play in this high stakes cash game. But it’s Las Vegas businessman Dave Krosky who’s confusing pros like Sam Grafton with his unpredictable playing style.

programme.title: Episode 8
programme.desc: More high stakes action from Las Vegas. ‘Loose Cannon’ Lily Newhouse switches up her style, while local entrepreneur Dave Krosky sticks to his maverick methods. But have the pros finally started to figure him out?

programme.title: Episode 9
programme.desc: The penultimate session of this high stakes cash games sees Las Vegas businessman Dave Krosky test the patience of his opponents. Meanwhile, pro players Maria Ho and Sam Grafton clash in a huge pot.

programme.title: Episode 10
programme.desc: The pressure is on, as this high stakes Vegas poker game concludes. Loose Cannon Lily only has a few hands left to make a profit. Can she find a spot? Meanwhile, Dave is playing wilder than ever.

programme.title: What She Wants

programme.title: Toxic Traits

programme.title: Fist of Vengeance

programme.title: Chi City Undercover

programme.title: Camille

programme.title: For the Gram

programme.title: The Frozen Hearts: A Love Story

Clint Meyers is a top-selling real estate agent and investor who projects sensitivity, but harbors a dark side. Their worlds collide when a chance encounter on a traumatic flight leads to a deadly obsession.

programme.title: Tom Horn
programme.desc: A renowned gunslinger with a storied past, Tom Horn (Steve McQueen) opts for a reclusive life until he starts working for rancher John Coble (Richard Farnsworth). Investigating livestock theft, Horn is brutal when dealing with criminals, and while his presence is initially appreciated, eventually the community grows concerned about the enforcer's violent methods.

programme.title: Harry Tracy
programme.desc: Famed outlaw Harry Tracy (Bruce Dern) is known for his daring train robberies, but lately he's concentrating more on matters of the heart. That's why he's traveling to Oregon to reunite with his sweetheart, Catherine Tuttle (Helen Shaver). She's the daughter of a judge, and it's no surprise that, when Tracy gets to Portland, he winds up behind bars. But no jail built can hold the desperado, and, after breaking out, Tracy finds himself on the run from every lawman in the state.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Tug of Words
programme.desc: Based on the playground game Tug-O-War, teams of two compete to answer word-clue questions correctly and pull the flag on the tug of war rope to their side.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The Walnut Tree Inn was in big trouble - there was no head chef, the customers had dwindled, and the owner had been forced to sell the family home to keep the business afloat. Set in beautiful Welsh countryside, The Walnut Tree Inn was a successful business for 37 years and became a national institution. But when Francesco bought the place 3 years ago he made the mistake of turning the warm and welcoming country inn into a cold and stark London-style restaurant. And when things went wrong he tried to run the kitchen as well as the front of house. With its Michelin star in jeopardy, Ramsay's first job was to recruit a new head chef so the owner could concentrate on customers. But has Francesco managed to follow Ramsay's advice and stop meddling in the kitchen?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Nick and Richard are self-confessed restaurant virgins. They've both had successful careers in the brewery business so when they bought Moore Place they believed they could make it an instant success. What they hadn't realized was just how difficult it would be to fill the 90-seater oak-paneled restaurant and how hard it would be to find a chef who could cook decent food.
Has Ramsay's fast-track guide to restaurant success helped these brewery whiz-kids transform their failing ex-Berni Inn into a profitable business? And is the building still painted that disgusting shade of purple?

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highlights from the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As Monty brings in the summer harvest, he gives advice on what to sow to keep the crops coming up to the end of Autumn. Carol Klein visits a woman who is losing her eyesight and gives her recommendations of plants that will be a feast for her senses.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Local Knowledge

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: It might be cold and windy, but if you have trust in your guide the result could be an epic day of fishing! Rush steps up to the challenge and puts Ali on an incredible bite of mutton snapper while also checking another species off of Ali's bucket list!

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Escape to the beautiful shores of Grand Isle, Louisiana where musician and community advocate David St. Romain joins Chef Jay Ducote for a weekend of fishing, crabbing, and oyster harvesting. Watch as Chef Mark Boudreaux of Hurricane Hole transforms their fresh catch into a culinary feast. Enjoy the thrill of fishing, the joy of cooking and the camaraderie of camp in The Bayou State.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Cajun classics are met with a Zimbabwean flair in this delicious mashup of cultures. Join Chef Jay Ducote and Food Network Star Rue Lindsay as they take on the fishing village of Cocodrie, Louisiana. Guided by Captain Zach LeBeouf, this tasty adventure will surely leave you hankering for more.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: In this episode, Captain C.A. is reminiscing with The Mogan Man, Blair Wiggins. Blair has over 20 years of television experience where he’s flipped inshore fishing upside down. Watch along as they relive the formative years and discuss a lifetime of fishing!
Joe Miles – Owner of Asio Gear, chases big whitetails in Kentucky, Kansas and Mexico!
Kris and Flint Seymour hunt down a Kansas giant!
After filming his son kill his first 200″ monster, Kris Seymour chases big bucks in Kansas, Oklahoma and Canada.

This week we celebrate the 40th Anniversary of Lone Wolf stands and the man that started it all, the Lone Wolf himself Andrae D’Acquisto. As we take a look back at Andrae’s career, how it all started and where its heading after 4 decades, Andrae shares some insights on his hunting strategies and the equipment he has designed that made him one of the top bowhunters in the country!
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!
Tarif Alkhatib hunts a couple giant whitetails in his home state of Texas!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Josh’s hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farm—it’s all on the menu.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledge—and point the way to the future."

programme.title: Dirt

It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Bonefish & Tarpon Trust
programme.desc: Watch the video to learn more about bonefish and tarpon connectivity and the importance of conservation at local and regional levels.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 2, Day 2, Mark Peterson continues his quest to complete the Upland Slam of 27 bird species in a series only available on YouTube, The Journey Within – A Bird Hunter’s Diary. Mark is in Alaska hunting the three species of ptarmigan; willow ptarmigan, white-tailed ptarmigan and rock ptarmigan. This is a two part episode where Mark is hunting with his father Earl as they cover miles of rocky terrain in search of these elusive birds in the high elevations of Alaska.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is still on the South Island of New Zealand chasing the Wingshooting Slam. It’s Mark's last day to complete the waterfowl portion of the slam and he still needs a Black Swan and a Shoveler. This hunt is taking place on a freshwater lake right off the ocean. The temperature is unusually warm for this time of year, but thankfully that hasn’t affected the numbers of birds around.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: It's day 2 in Wyoming and Mark Peterson is hunting the opening day of Sage Grouse with his dad, Earl. Join them and their dogs on this high elevation Sage Grouse hunt, covering some of the best grouse habitat in the country.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: The last hunt in this series takes us to Texas in February of 2017. This time Mark is after his first Aoudad with a muzzleloader. Aoudad were introduced to Texas as an exotic species and it didn't take long for them to establish a large viable population in the ideal habitat that West Texas offers. Going into this hunt with the confidence and extended range that only Gunwerks can provide, Mark knows the odds are in his favor and it doesn't take long to come across multiple bands of rams. Thanks for following along in this 3 part series as we looked back on some of Mark's most memorable hunts for these incredible animals found all over the world. Click the link below to join and learn more about The Wild Sheep Foundation.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 3, Day 3, Mark Peterson wraps up his time in Wyoming upland hunting with an epic partridge hunt. Does he run into some chukars along the way? Take a look inside this episode to find out!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson’s Journey in Argentina continues with some morning madness. Taking four animals, this is one of the best morning hunts he has had yet. After an already incredible week of hunting, Mark is looking for a few species that caught his attention earlier in the trip and turns up a Hybrid Sheep, Hybrid Mouflon, Feral Goat and a Multi Horn Sheep. Temps are abnormally hot in Argentina for this time of year and the animals will be heading for cover by mid day to stay cool. Mark and his guide Charley make a plan to cover a lot of ground in hopes of catching them out feeding before they disappear.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 4, Mark Peterson ventures to South Dakota for prairie chickens and sharp-tailed grouse. South Dakota is well known as the pheasant hunting capital of the world, but with its rolling prairie lands, also holds great habitat and numbers of prairie chicken and sharp-tail grouse. Take a look as Mark chases both and find out if he connects.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the “Slam guy.” He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark and Earl set out to check species number 21, the chukar, off their upland slam list. Typically chukars live at higher elevations making it an earned feat to harvest one. Can Mark and Earl battle steep rocky terrain at over 4000 feet in elevation? Stay tuned for more The Journey Within Episodes every Thursday. We are getting close with Mark only needing to harvest another 6 species!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's early November and Mark Peterson heads north of the border to Saskatchewan to chase down his Northwestern whitetail. Unseasonably cold temps are staring Mark in the face and it has the deer hunkered down for a day and a half, but the power of food prevailed. On day two, with only 8 minutes left of shooting light, Mark's target buck showed up.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his father, Earl, travel down to the great state of Kansas in hops to knock another quail species off their list. The North American Bobwhite Quail hold very tight and fly spastically from their covey. River bottoms and thick grasslands are the habitat of choice of these fast fliers. A river crossing and a broken up covey allow Mark to check the Bobwhite Quail off his list. Only a few species left to complete the Journey Within - A bird Hunters Diary!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is duck hunting for the 4th day in Argentina and finds that luck is on his side. He and Matt head to a blind for an early morning hunt in hopes of getting a Black Headed Duck before they disappear for the day in the reeds. He also still needs a Red Shoveler, but things take a quick turn while he is walking through the marsh, about to call it a day. Enjoy this episode of The Journey Within

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and the new producer (Tim Guidroz) go out on their first turkey hunt together, and even though the weather is not ideal, they get the job done on a Wilkinson County gobbler. We also get a look at what the United Country - Southern States Realty office looks like during turkey season, with interviews from Scott Lindsey and Caleb Armstrong, and three big properties closing in Baton Rouge.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade takes Bentley on his very first duck hunt. Slade also gets to take a trip to duck hunting paradise with some great buddies of his. This episode is all about having a great time with great friends.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes us through his new investment property, and breaks downwhat’s involved in taking a raw land tract and creating extremely desirable turn-keyhunting properties.Caleb and Slade double up on some Wilkinson County gobblers for Calebs first turkeykill ever.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade goes over what he’s doing at his home property to create summer food plots for deer, and gives tips to those looking to do the same. On the final hunt for the 2024 season, Lori gets a big Wilkinson County gobbler.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade is staying busy busy around the house, lots of testing on summer plots with Deergro and Backwoods bachelor pad blend. Also, there locally he takes a quick look at the new 60 acres he and Ryan bought as an investment property. Then ends with a throwback hunt from under the barn.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his brother Tai take us around a new investment property - a 55 acre tract in Wilkinson County, MS and go over what it took to take an undesirable raw tract, to a place with multiple offers on the first day it was put on the market.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Watch as Lori tags her first turkey of the season as well as the daily grind and comments from the office in McComb, Mississippi. The ladies in the office isn’t too fond of turkey season until it’s their turn.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Dive into the exhilarating world of tarpon fishing in the historic city of St. Augustine, Florida. Join Capt. Danny as henavigates the timeless waters of the oldest city in Florida, seeking the mighty tarpon. These fish will test your angling skills and endurance.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Headed out of Crystal River once again, Capt. Blair & Capt. Mike Avinon of Circle Hook Fishing Charters head way out deep again for a few different species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: It might be cold and windy, but if you have trust in your guide the result could be an epic day of fishing! Rush steps up to the challenge and puts Ali on an incredible bite of mutton snapper while also checking another species off of Ali's bucket list!

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Escape to the beautiful shores of Grand Isle, Louisiana where musician and community advocate David St. Romain joins Chef Jay Ducote for a weekend of fishing, crabbing, and oyster harvesting. Watch as Chef Mark Boudreaux of Hurricane Hole transforms their fresh catch into a culinary feast. Enjoy the thrill of fishing, the joy of cooking and the camaraderie of camp in The Bayou State.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Cajun classics are met with a Zimbabwean flair in this delicious mashup of cultures. Join Chef Jay Ducote and Food Network Star Rue Lindsay as they take on the fishing village of Cocodrie, Louisiana. Guided by Captain Zach LeBeouf, this tasty adventure will surely leave you hankering for more.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: In this episode, Captain C.A. is reminiscing with The Mogan Man, Blair Wiggins. Blair has over 20 years of television experience where he’s flipped inshore fishing upside down. Watch along as they relive the formative years and discuss a lifetime of fishing!
Joe Miles – Owner of Asio Gear, chases big whitetails in Kentucky, Kansas and Mexico!
Kris and Flint Seymour hunt down a Kansas giant!
After filming his son kill his first 200″ monster, Kris Seymour chases big bucks in Kansas, Oklahoma and Canada.

This week we celebrate the 40th Anniversary of Lone Wolf stands and the man that started it all, the Lone Wolf himself Andrae D’Acquisto. As we take a look back at Andrae’s career, how it all started and where its heading after 4 decades, Andrae shares some insights on his hunting strategies and the equipment he has designed that made him one of the top bowhunters in the country!
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!
Tarif Alkhatib hunts a couple giant whitetails in his home state of Texas!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Josh’s hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farm—it’s all on the menu.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledge—and point the way to the future."

programme.title: Bonefish & Tarpon Trust
programme.desc: Watch the video to learn more about bonefish and tarpon connectivity and the importance of conservation at local and regional levels.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 2, Day 2, Mark Peterson continues his quest to complete the Upland Slam of 27 bird species in a series only available on YouTube, The Journey Within – A Bird Hunter’s Diary. Mark is in Alaska hunting the three species of ptarmigan; willow ptarmigan, white-tailed ptarmigan and rock ptarmigan. This is a two part episode where Mark is hunting with his father Earl as they cover miles of rocky terrain in search of these elusive birds in the high elevations of Alaska.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is still on the South Island of New Zealand chasing the Wingshooting Slam. It’s Mark's last day to complete the waterfowl portion of the slam and he still needs a Black Swan and a Shoveler. This hunt is taking place on a freshwater lake right off the ocean. The temperature is unusually warm for this time of year, but thankfully that hasn’t affected the numbers of birds around.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: It's day 2 in Wyoming and Mark Peterson is hunting the opening day of Sage Grouse with his dad, Earl. Join them and their dogs on this high elevation Sage Grouse hunt, covering some of the best grouse habitat in the country.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: The last hunt in this series takes us to Texas in February of 2017. This time Mark is after his first Aoudad with a muzzleloader. Aoudad were introduced to Texas as an exotic species and it didn't take long for them to establish a large viable population in the ideal habitat that West Texas offers. Going into this hunt with the confidence and extended range that only Gunwerks can provide, Mark knows the odds are in his favor and it doesn't take long to come across multiple bands of rams. Thanks for following along in this 3 part series as we looked back on some of Mark's most memorable hunts for these incredible animals found all over the world. Click the link below to join and learn more about The Wild Sheep Foundation.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 3, Day 3, Mark Peterson wraps up his time in Wyoming upland hunting with an epic partridge hunt. Does he run into some chukars along the way? Take a look inside this episode to find out!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson’s Journey in Argentina continues with some morning madness. Taking four animals, this is one of the best morning hunts he has had yet. After an already incredible week of hunting, Mark is looking for a few species that caught his attention earlier in the trip and turns up a Hybrid Sheep, Hybrid Mouflon, Feral Goat and a Multi Horn Sheep. Temps are abnormally hot in Argentina for this time of year and the animals will be heading for cover by mid day to stay cool. Mark and his guide Charley make a plan to cover a lot of ground in hopes of catching them out feeding before they disappear.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: In Part 4, Mark Peterson ventures to South Dakota for prairie chickens and sharp-tailed grouse. South Dakota is well known as the pheasant hunting capital of the world, but with its rolling prairie lands, also holds great habitat and numbers of prairie chicken and sharp-tail grouse. Take a look as Mark chases both and find out if he connects.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the “Slam guy.” He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark and Earl set out to check species number 21, the chukar, off their upland slam list. Typically chukars live at higher elevations making it an earned feat to harvest one. Can Mark and Earl battle steep rocky terrain at over 4000 feet in elevation? Stay tuned for more The Journey Within Episodes every Thursday. We are getting close with Mark only needing to harvest another 6 species!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's early November and Mark Peterson heads north of the border to Saskatchewan to chase down his Northwestern whitetail. Unseasonably cold temps are staring Mark in the face and it has the deer hunkered down for a day and a half, but the power of food prevailed. On day two, with only 8 minutes left of shooting light, Mark's target buck showed up.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his father, Earl, travel down to the great state of Kansas in hops to knock another quail species off their list. The North American Bobwhite Quail hold very tight and fly spastically from their covey. River bottoms and thick grasslands are the habitat of choice of these fast fliers. A river crossing and a broken up covey allow Mark to check the Bobwhite Quail off his list. Only a few species left to complete the Journey Within - A bird Hunters Diary!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is duck hunting for the 4th day in Argentina and finds that luck is on his side. He and Matt head to a blind for an early morning hunt in hopes of getting a Black Headed Duck before they disappear for the day in the reeds. He also still needs a Red Shoveler, but things take a quick turn while he is walking through the marsh, about to call it a day. Enjoy this episode of The Journey Within

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and the new producer (Tim Guidroz) go out on their first turkey hunt together, and even though the weather is not ideal, they get the job done on a Wilkinson County gobbler. We also get a look at what the United Country - Southern States Realty office looks like during turkey season, with interviews from Scott Lindsey and Caleb Armstrong, and three big properties closing in Baton Rouge.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade takes Bentley on his very first duck hunt. Slade also gets to take a trip to duck hunting paradise with some great buddies of his. This episode is all about having a great time with great friends.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes us through his new investment property, and breaks downwhat’s involved in taking a raw land tract and creating extremely desirable turn-keyhunting properties.Caleb and Slade double up on some Wilkinson County gobblers for Calebs first turkeykill ever.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade goes over what he’s doing at his home property to create summer food plots for deer, and gives tips to those looking to do the same. On the final hunt for the 2024 season, Lori gets a big Wilkinson County gobbler.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade is staying busy busy around the house, lots of testing on summer plots with Deergro and Backwoods bachelor pad blend. Also, there locally he takes a quick look at the new 60 acres he and Ryan bought as an investment property. Then ends with a throwback hunt from under the barn.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his brother Tai take us around a new investment property - a 55 acre tract in Wilkinson County, MS and go over what it took to take an undesirable raw tract, to a place with multiple offers on the first day it was put on the market.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Watch as Lori tags her first turkey of the season as well as the daily grind and comments from the office in McComb, Mississippi. The ladies in the office isn’t too fond of turkey season until it’s their turn.

programme.desc: Continuation of the podcast between Caleb and Slade on land investing.

programme.title: Lucky Number Slevin
programme.desc: A mysterious man is roped into a dangerous feud between two rival crime kingpins, neither of whom can step foot outside for fear of assassination.

programme.title: Confidence
programme.desc: A charming con man sets up the grift of a lifetime that will avenge his friend’s murder, pay off his own debts, and get him out of the hustling game.
